metadata.title: CVE-2017-12602 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) through 3.3 has a denial ofservice (memory consumption) issue, as demonstrated by the10-opencv-dos-memory-exhaust test case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-contrib3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-core3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
libopencv-features2d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1
